basicInfo.notes: Founded in 2002 in a dorm room. Acquired by Endurance International Group (EIG) in June 2012. EIG merged with Web.com to form Newfold Digital in 2021. Hosts over 2 million domains. Sister company to Bluehost under Newfold Digital umbrella. Corporate office in Houston, Texas. Data centers in Provo, Utah and Houston, Texas.

pricing.moneyBackExclusions: Dedicated servers excluded (30 days only); Domain registrations non-refundable ($17.99 fee if free domain used and cancelled within first year); SSL certificates non-refundable; SiteLock and CodeGuard non-refundable; Administrative fees non-refundable; PayPal and credit card payments only

policiesOverages.bandwidthOveragePolicy: Unmetered within fair use; must stay within typical personal/small business range
policiesOverages.storageOveragePolicy: Unmetered within fair use; exceeding 100K inodes removes from weekly backups; 200K+ inodes violates AUP
policiesOverages.accountSuspensionPolicy: AUP violations may result in suspension or termination without notice; 100K+ inodes excluded from backups; 200K+ inodes flagged for review/suspension
policiesOverages.resourceAbuseDefinition: Exceeding 100,000 inodes (soft limit); exceeding 200,000 inodes (AUP violation); 5GB per single database; 10GB total database usage; storing non-web files; bitcoin mining
policiesOverages.hiddenFeesNotes: Renewal prices triple from promo; $17.99 domain fee if free domain used and cancelled within 1 year; Daily backups require CodeGuard add-on; Malware removal requires SiteLock add-on; Weekly backups only if <20GB and <100K inodes; Cannot choose server location; Aggressive upselling tactics reported

business.affiliateCommissionAmount: $50-$125 per sale depending on volume; 60-day cookie; via Impact Radius

editorial.knownIssues: Renewal prices triple from promo rates; Only 2 US data centers (no international options); Cannot choose server location; Weekly backups only (and only if account <20GB/<100K inodes); Daily backups and malware removal require paid add-ons; Aggressive upselling tactics widely reported; Post-EIG acquisition complaints about declining service quality; Average support wait times (15 min calls); No staging environment on shared hosting; Reddit complaints about predatory billing practices
editorial.bestFor: Budget beginners (45-day money-back); Users needing 24/7 phone support; cPanel users; US-based websites (2 US data centers); Users wanting longer money-back guarantee than competitors; VPS users needing managed cPanel/WHM
editorial.avoidIf: Need international server locations; Budget-conscious at renewal time (triples); Need daily backups included; Need staging environment; Sensitive to aggressive upselling; Need malware removal included; Want more than 1 backup copy retained
editorial.competitorComparisonNotes: Same parent (Newfold) as Bluehost; 45-day money-back vs 30 days most competitors; Only 2 data centers vs 10-11 at SiteGround/Hostinger; No staging (Hostinger/SiteGround have it); Weekly backups with conditions vs daily at SiteGround; $149.99 migration vs $35 SiteGround; cPanel included (unlike Hostinger hPanel); Lower Trustpilot (4.5) than SiteGround (4.8); VPS cheaper than Bluehost ($34.99 vs $46.99)

comparisonData.uniqueSellingPoint: Budget cPanel hosting with 45-day money-back guarantee and 24/7 phone support
comparisonData.idealCustomerProfile: Budget beginner wanting cPanel and phone support with extended refund period

faqContent.faqIsThisHostGood: HostGator is decent for budget beginners wanting cPanel and phone support, but has aggressive upselling, limited features, and only US data centers.
faqContent.faqWhoOwnsThisHost: HostGator is owned by Newfold Digital (formerly Endurance International Group), the same company that owns Bluehost.
faqContent.faqHowMuchDoesItCost: HostGator shared hosting starts at $2.75/month (promo) and renews at $11.95/month. First year costs approximately $33.
faqContent.faqIsItBeginnerFriendly: Yes, HostGator offers cPanel and 24/7 phone support, making it beginner-friendly despite aggressive upselling.
faqContent.faqDoesItIncludeEmail: Yes, HostGator includes unlimited email accounts with shared hosting plans.
faqContent.faqCanIHostWordPress: Yes, HostGator offers WordPress hosting with auto-install and auto-updates, but no staging environment on shared plans.
faqContent.faqWhatsTheUptime: HostGator guarantees 99.9% uptime with SLA credits for downtime.
faqContent.faqCanICancelAnytime: Yes, with a 45-day money-back guarantee (longer than most competitors). $17.99 deducted if free domain was used.
